definition: to rake in (money)/to plunder/to milk people dry
to scrape/to blow/to shave/to plunder/to extort

sentences.english: If the Bank of Japan doesn't want to buck the currency markets, why would I want to try?
sentences.chinese: 如果日本銀行不想在貨幣市場搜刮，我爲什麼想做呢？

sentences.english: May the creditor seize all his belongings and strangers plunder the fruits of his toil.
sentences.chinese: 使債主搜刮他所有的家產，使外人劫掠他勞力的所賺。

sentences.english: It was time to go out and scare a few people and raid their houses.
sentences.chinese: 看來該是時候出去嚇嚇人，搜刮搜刮他們的房子咯。

sentences.english: It was time to go out and scare a few people and raid their houses.
sentences.chinese: 看來該是時候出去嚇嚇人，搜刮搜刮他們的房子咯。

sentences.english: Officials said he could have made thousands of dollars (euros) by pulling the same stunt.
sentences.chinese: 當局官員說，他因施此伎倆而搜刮了幾千元錢。

sentences.english: Search engine of development in e-commerce plays an important role.
sentences.chinese: 搜刮引擎正在電子商務中抵章飯謝起追守要做用。

sentences.english: When her uncle died, she grabbed everything she could get her hands on.
sentences.chinese: 她叔叔死後，她儘可能搜刮所能得到的一切東西。

definition: to gather (people)/to collect (talent)/to come to an end
lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
